Prey: Bony fish, other sharks, crustaceans, squid, skates and rays
Fun Fact: The sand tiger is the shark most commonly seen in aquariums.
Estimated Population Size: Unknown, but its population decreased by 20 percent in just the last decade due to overfishing.
Most Distinctive Feature: It gulps air to keep buoyant.
Other Name(s): spotted ragged-tooth shark, blue-nurse sand tiger, grey nurse shark, spotted sand tiger shark, chien de mer, dogfish shark, slender-tooth shark, magonga, requin taureau, ground shark
Habitat: Shallow tropical and temperate waters close to the shore
Name: Sand Tiger Shark
